channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2023111286
item.description:
Report X-2023111286

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED DISTRESSED/STAINED IN APPEARANCE IN THE OVERGOOD'S CAGE BY A CLERK ALSO CERTIFIED AS A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. AFTER DONNING PROPER PPE, UTILIZING A FULLY STOCKED RESPONSE CART AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE PARCEL WAS CONTAINED (NO ACTIVE SPILLAGE) THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA.

item.title: Report E-2023110531
item.description:
Report E-2023110531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN1210 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized oil dry and absorbent pads to remediate the site. All spent oil dry and absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the two (2) damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks for terminal disposal.

  • City: TOLEDO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered leaking on the skid. The drum was immediately turned on to it's side and into an overpack container to prevent further release. The released material was collected using absorbent material and placed into an overpack for proper disposal. Investigation revealed that the drum was punctured by a protruding nail from the skid it was placed on. Due to the hazard of material, the package specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing (UN2735) Sulfix 9252 Scavenger released 1-gallon of product onto the trailer floor as a result of a crack on the top of the tote. It is likely that the tote was not adequately prepared and/or secured for transport. A contractor neutralized that release and cleaned-up the trailer floor. The remaining contents of the tote were transferred into a new, intact tote. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.description:
Report E-2023110351

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: FLINT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Environmental Restoration personnel observed a 3ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor impacted by approximately one (1) cup of released material from one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to a nail puncture during forklift operations. Environmental Restoration personnel deployed Soda Ash to the impacted area and recovered the neutralized material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged 1-gallon plastic jug along with three (3) impacted 1-gallon plastic jugs were placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET AND LEAKING. IMMEDIATELY TOOK PKG OVER TO THE K=HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT. I REPACKED IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIAMTELY 2 OUNCES LEAKED OUT DUE TO A CAP BEING LOOSE ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES ON THE INSIDE OF THE PKG. AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES WHICH CAUSED APPROXIMATELY 2 OUNCES TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PKG OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT. THEN REPACKING IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2023110813
item.description:
Report X-2023110813

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was on QA rollers at beginning of AM sort with an inspection required scan (usual process and placement of pkg for us). Sr QA Admin inspected pkg, cutting it open and pulling out all 4 cans; no evidence of leakage but all 4 cans were dented. Pkg put back into sort. Wet bottom on pkg found on 200 belt and was sent to QA. When starting to complete HESS, QA found the UN # on OP-900 did not match the UN # on the cans. Paperwork shows UN1133 (adhesive); can labels show UN1123 (a thinner) which is consistent with the odor of the leakage. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 cans were heavily dented along the bottom seams. Both had pinhole leaks on the bottom. No punctures visible on bottom of shipping box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg place in plastic tote. QA person opened box and turned the 2 leaking cans upside down to stop the seepage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDE experienced a UN1206 R-822 release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of material released to a 2 x 5 area of the trailer floor and a 2 x 3 area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged pail was then containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110337
item.description:
Report E-2023110337

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 25-gallon release of Methyl Chloroform-343 (UN2831) from a 55-gallon metal drum. The product is regulated as a UN2831, 1,1,1 Trichloroethena, 6.1, III. Because of the toxic hazardous properties of the material, ERTS advised they would be sending a contractor to assist with this spill. One of the drums of the product was punctured by a forklift during unloading by the LSL terminal, causing the release to impact the trailer interior, pallet, and dock. The drum was tipped onto its side to prevent further spilling and absorbents were deployed onto the spilled area. The terminal uprighted the drum and deployed absorbents. Upon contractor arrival it was estimated 1Gal was released in a 4'x4' area. 1-85 gallon DM / contains overpacked drum, impacted absorbentsand 1-55 gallon DM / contains impacted absorbents, PPE were left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: On November 15, 2023 at 2041 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallons of Inferno (UN1824, Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) plastic- IBC tote that cracked due to a load shift releasing product onto the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The remaining product in the damaged tote was then transferred into a new plastic IBC tote without complication. All waste generated from addressing the release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110324
item.description:
Report E-2023110324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: ST JAMES
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 AM a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Caustic Soda to a customer site (Mosaic) located in St. James, LA. The driver met with the customer site operator, completed the In the Interest of Safety Form (which is a form utilized by Basic Chemical truck drivers to ensure that enough space exists in a customer tank prior to unloading), hooked up offloading hoses, and began offloading. Near the end of offloading, the driver knew the tanker trailer was getting close to being empty, so he got with the customer site operator to check the level of the storage tank again to ensure there was enough room remaining in the product storage tank. The operator checked the level of the storage tank and confirmed with the driver that there was enough space to complete the offload. Not long after the customer site operator left the area the storage tank began to overflow and the Basic Chemicals truck driver immediately shut down the flow of product. The driver got with the customer site operator to notify him of the overflow and the operator stated that the tank level indicator had been malfunctioning lately. Customer site personnel were able to clean up the spill which was estimated to be approximately 20 gallons. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of Part B released to a 1 x 1 area of the cardboard on the trailer floor due to being crushed. A second pail containing Part A was also damaged, releasing approximately 0.25-gallons. Spill pads were utilized to wipe up the released product. item.title: Report E-2023110254
item.description:
Report E-2023110254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: PRAIRIE GROVE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: OCCIDENTAL CHEMICAL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:00 on Friday, November 3, 2023, a Basic Chemicals truck driver was delivering Hydrochloric Acid to a customer site (AZZ Inc.) located in Prairie Grove, AR. When the driver began to offload product they immediately noticed the cam-lock connection at the customers connection was dripping, so they shut down the process, cleared the line and shimmed the cam-lock ears. The driver resumed unloading a second time and noticed the fitting continued to drip so they closed the internal valve on top of the tanker trailer and replaced the gasket at the cam-lock connection. When the driver reopened the internal valve, product was released from the CPVC piping system that is connected to the internal valve of the trailer. Approximately 2 cups of product was release and spilled. No injuries or damage to equipment was reported.

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On November 07, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of UN1866 Resin Solution, Flammable, 3, III from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a small area on the side of the drum only. Contractors inspected the trailer and confirmed there was no evidence of a release onto the trailer floor but found 2 additional damaged drums that were not leaking. The impacted drum was wiped clean, and the 3 damaged drums were transferred into a metal overpack without complication. The overpacks and the rest of the cargo were secured for transport and forwarded on to the original consignee. Contractors did not collect any waste during this ER response.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSJ experienced a UN1866 P077-310 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of material released to a 20 x 8 area of the trailer floor, a 20 x 15 area of the concrete dock floor and a 12 x 8 area of the concrete lot below the trailer due to a puncture caused by impact with other freight. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris were containerized into (6) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110510
item.description:
Report E-2023110510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: TROY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the loading dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Moran Environmental Recovery (MER) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to scrape the released product off the loading dock floor. MER personnel utilized absorbent pads with a degreasing agent to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. Crews then utilized a rotary transfer pump to transfer the contents of the damaged 275-gallon tote to a new 275-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. MER personnel deployed granular absorbents inside the damaged tote, to solidify any remaining product, once the rotary transfer pump stopped. Crews then placed absorbent pads, under the damaged tote, and wrapped the tote in two (2) layers of poly sheeting to ensure any additional residual product was contained. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1830-impacted trailer and dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. ES personnel transferred the product from the 275-gallon tote to a 275-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal and the damaged tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report E-2023110227

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN2920 Spectrus NX1103 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of material released to an 8 x 8 area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. A soap and water solution was utilized to clean all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all material. The damaged jug and impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged cut up pallet was placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted surfaces were scrubbed and treated thoroughly but still showed signs of staining, and all surfaces passed the water test. All other unaffected jugs were re-stacked to continue to the destination. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 13, 2023, two (2) 275-gallon totes of UN3109 were defective and released approximately seventy-five (75) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE began to unload and remediate the impacted cargo. Crews transferred approximately 200 gallons of organic peroxide from the damaged tote into a new tote. Crews cut up the empty tote and added it to a 55-gallon drum for disposal. FCE replaced the cap on the tote missing its cap. All impacted pallets, cardboard, and debris were collected for disposal

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCO experienced a release from (6) 65-pound UN2794, Batteries, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-gallons of battery acid released to a 4 x 7 area of the trailer floor due improper loading. Each damaged battery was placed into its own 55-gallon poly drum. A sodium bicarb solution was then utilized to clean the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents, impacted pallet pieces, and PPE were placed into a seventh 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IT was reported a one-cup spill of UN3288 "ZINC CHROMATE CZ20" that arrived damaged at Terminal NCH. The caller stated that (1) a 55-pound paper bag was damaged due to freight impact as a result of a load shift impacting Trailer #321-6239. The contractor arrived and noted the material was spilled inside of the trailer and left a trail leading out onto the dock where the pallet containing the damaged bag was. The contractor was able to confirm the dock plate prevented any material from releasing onto the ground beneath the trailer. The pallet was restacked; the damaged bag and released material were placed into (1) 55-poly drum. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110449
item.description:
Report E-2023110449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, four (4) 55-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. A HEPA-filtered drum vacuum was used to collect all freestanding product. The undamaged cargo was re-palletized for continued processing and shipping. The damaged bags were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents of the vacuum and all UN3378-impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023110448
item.description:
Report E-2023110448

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted-trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. EWI placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110446
item.description:
Report E-2023110446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 25-pound pail of UN2880 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail of calcium hypochlorite and all the released product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110444
item.description:
Report E-2023110444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1139 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On November 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a faulty pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was containerized into an 85-gallon over-pack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum, both for terminal disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbent, the damaged pails, and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On November 6, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint- impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1824 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. MSES personnel then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in using hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. The empty 5-gallon jug, all spent absorbents, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:

  • City: HUNTSVILLE

  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) one-gallon pail of UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. Crews neutralized the impacted surfaces with a sprayer, soda ash solution, and absorbent pads, and they pH tested the surfaces to ensure they were sufficiently neutralized. MEG personnel placed the one (1) impacted 1-gallon pail, used absorbent pads, and any cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon bucket that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: On 10/19/23 a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO was observed to be leaking. Upon investigation it was discovered that three 28-gallon plastic bins containing IV bags fell over while in transportation due to the shipment not being properly secured. After the containers fell, some of the IV Bags fell and ruptured due to weight and impact. Approximately 15 gallons released onto the trailer floor and ground beneath the trailer. Facility personnel conducted cleanup operations.

item.title: Report E-2023110269
item.description:
Report E-2023110269

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee at Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Fremont, CA was moving two 55 gal drums to load onto a trailer with a forklift. The forklift had a double drum attachment which was used to pick up and move the drums. The employee raised the forklift but he failed to lift the drums high enough which resulted in one of the drum being smashed between the drum attachment stabilizing bar and the trailer floor frame. This resulted in one of the drums being crushed and causing a leak. Another employee got on the forklift and quickly brought the drums down to the ground and disengaged the drum grabber so that the drum could be tilted to the side to minimize the spill. Other Veolia employees quickly grabbed absorbent and contained the spill. The damaged drum was placed into an 85 gal poly salvage drum and absorbent was used to cleaned the area. Pressure washer was used to decontaminated the affected area. The spilled occurred on asphalt and did not result in release to the environment.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was crushed into itself which gave us time and the ability to go pick up the package and put it into a Hazmat tote. item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/31/2023, at 0959 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered GATX5945, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Veolia, was notified directly. Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a pressure relief vent with a blown rupture disc. After inspection it was found that the PRV did not have the required surge protection. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jeff Humphries. Contractor personnel removed the blown rupture disk and installed anew 2 SS 165 psi rupture disk, decontaminated the car, and remediated the environmental impact. The car was held at Radnor Yard pending additional repairs by a certified Mobile Repair Unit.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit the driver stopped for a break and performed a load check and noticed a dark orangish liquid dripping for his trailer around 0930. The driver then put down some absorbent pads and a bucket to help mitigate the release. He then called in to report the release. We then dispatched a team to go out to the seen and start the clean up process. The team arrived on seen at approximately 1500 and dawned the proper PPE and began the clean up procedure. The drum had a small pinhole above the top chime that looks like it may have been rubbing against another container or pallet during transit. The drum was overpacked and all absorbent material was disposed of and transported for disposal per proper regulation.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately half a gallon or less of Unisol Liquid Red SPX (UN1268), which released from (1) 350-gallon metal tote. It was reported the gasket on top of the tote was not sealed properly, causing the liquid to slosh about during transit and spill out along the top and the sides of the tote. Only the top of the tote was impacted, no impact to the floor or surrounding areas. The contractor was able to replace the seal on the tote, securing it. The remaining product was able to continue transport.

  • Description: On October 27, 2023, eight (8) one-gallon jugs of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3264-impacted impacted trailer and concrete pavement. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. ES+ personnel solidified the damaged jugs of product. The damaged jugs and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On October 11, 2023 at 11:45 during a joint Mechanical inspection with FRA at the Conrail Pavonia Terminal PROX 280095 a residue tank car of acetone dripping from the bottom outlet valve of the tank car. Upon inspection it was found that the bottom outlet valve was partially open and the closure pin was not in place. The valve was closed and the pin was replaced in the retainer thus stopping the leak. Marion Environmental, an approved Conrail Contractor was notified to respond, inspect and secure the tank car. Marion personnel, removed the bottom outlet cap and drained the product below the valve. They also found both the liquid and vapor valve secondary plugs less than tool tight. Once the tank car was secured it was released to transportation. FRA Hazardous Material Inspector, Joe Bowen made notifications to both the Shipper and Consignee of the incident. Cause Code: 2 x ( 4 + 3 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 0 ) = 28

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On October 23, 2023, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the damage of approximately (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II) was punctured, with NO release seen. They were able to transfer the contents of the drum into a new 65-gallon poly overpack without complication. The 65-gallon poly overpack containerized waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110060
item.description:
Report E-2023110060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: TARRANT
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN EARTH SPECIALTY WASTE SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tanker had been picked up from a 3rd party tanker cleaning company. The investigation revealed that during the cleanout the 3rd party had removed the cleanout port cap on top of the tanker and didn't fully secure the cap once the tanker was cleaned out. The tanker was then sent to pickup a load at PPG Industries, the driver only checked the top hatch and hose valves after loading. Upon leaving the shipping facility the driver stopped at a scale 40 miles away, there was no evidence at this time of any release. Upon reaching his final destination he noticed material had sprayed out of the top of the tanker from the top of the tanker from the cleanout port. The cap was still affixed but he was able to hand tighten it. Based upon scale tickets from the beginning and end of his trip we were able to determine the amount that had released 45lbs = 5 gallons. The tanker showed signs of the material spraying onto the top portion of tanker.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCF experienced a customer location release of UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% from (3) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 10 x 30 area of the trailer and concrete lot below. The release occurred due to high temps expanding the totes/loose caps as well as small puncture holes in the tote bodies. The material in the three totes were transferred into new totes. Soda ash was utilized to neutralize the release & absorbents were then deployed to clean all released product. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101231
item.description:
Report X-2023101231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-22
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Responded to report of Nitric acid leak from tank car GATX220384 in Brosnan Yard Macon GA. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was coming from the liquid line valve. The liquid line valve was in closed position but product was leaking past the valve and the secondary closure cam lock cap. The cam Lock cap was missing a gasket. A gasket was installed for the cap and 4psi of pressure was scrubbed off of the tank car. The leak was stopped. The car will be held pending transfer of load.

item.title: Report X-2023101230
item.description:
Report X-2023101230

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: MUSCLE SHOALS
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported tank car GATX73831 leaking from the top of the car. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found to be from the liquid valve blind flange. The leak resulted from a defective blind flange gasket and product leaking past the closed liquid line valve. A new blind flange gasket was installed and the leak stopped. The shipper was notified and is arranging for a certified mobile shop to replace the valve.

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN3265 was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 30-gallon drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed soda ash to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was received damaged. Pkg. had liquid leaking from bottom of box, taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting pkg., it was noted that there were 2, 1 gallon containers of Corrosive material, pkg. was not declared a Hazmat by shipper. There were no labels, orientation arrows, hazmat shipping paper work of any type. We noticed it was a Hazmat by looking at the container, has Corrosive label on it. Cans were stacked on top of each other in box, just brown paper to protect contents. We searched to see if shipper was an Authorized Shipper, they are not. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in bin in HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH. Will reach out to customer to see if they are willing to pick up the undamaged container.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in unload by package handler. QA noticed it was a dry wet spot, on the box. Taking a look inside QA noticed that the product said it was Sulfuric Acid. There was no labeling on package to state it was a hazmat. QA checked for the SDS and it was an actually Hazardous material. QA got a red tote and brought package to the hazmat area. DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was loose and spilled out inside box. The peanuts inside did not cover the bottles entirely. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Brought package to hazmat area in red tote to be processed properly.

QA got a red tote and transported the hazmat to the rightful place to processed properly. DescribePack: The package had no inner packing inside the package, which highly caused the bottle's cap to become loose. No care was put in transporting a corrosive hazardous item. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed hazmat in red tote and brought it to the hazmat area to be processed properly.

  • City: MAPLE GROVE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF A LEAKEING HAZMAT AT BAY 210. UPPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS LEAKING ON THE FLOOR INFRONT OF THE TRAILER. AFTER CLEANING UP THE LEAKED CONTENTS RESPONDER BROUGHT THE MATERIAL BACK TO THE DMP TO BE PROCESSED. WHILE DISPOSING OF THE MATERIALS IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THERE WERE 4 1GAL CONTAINER WITH PIN HILE VENTED CAPS AND ONE OF THE CAPS WAS MISSING THE PAPER PLUG UNDERNEATH THE CAP ALLOWING THE CONTENTS TO MORE EASILY LEAK OUT OF THE VENTED PIN HOLE.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP AT 3:45 AM, FROM DOOR 38, ON THE UNLOAD. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN, ONE, 1 GALLON METAL CAN, OF ZIP TAC 3 ACCELERATOR, BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN1219, ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, 3, II, 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 1 GALLON). THE CAP ON THE METAL CANS ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE ALCOHOL SOLUTION TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTER CARTON, THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL IN THE BOX. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

All three of them were not upright by the orientation arrows. They were placed into a red hazardous waste totes and brought over to QA. DescribePack: The caps are vented and since they were found on its side and not upright. It leaked out slowly through the vented cap. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: put all the bottles upright to prevent from leaking.

item.title: Report E-2023110381
item.description:
Report E-2023110381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WEATHERFORD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had loaded diesel into compartments 1,3 and 4, Driver states he put out cones and stuck tanks. Driver started unloading Compartment 4 into tank 5 and Compartment 1 into tank 4. Driver states that tank 5 had 81 in tank prior to dropping and tank 4 had 80. Compartment 4 Tank 5 drop completed, and the driver drained the hose and disconnected from truck but left the drop hooked up to ground connection. Driver was planning to move the hose and drop gun from compartment 4 tank 5 to compartment 3 tank 7. Driver checked the other hose and notice the well on tank 4 started to fill up. Driver shut down unloading from compartment 1. The manifold system between the tanks caused tank 5 to fill the well along with product to come back out of hose on the ground. Driver tried to cap the end of the hose that was still hooked up to tank 5 drop and was sprayed with diesel. Driver had to drop the rest of compartment 1 into tank 7. All the diesel tanks are Mani folded together.

item.title: Report E-2023110232

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-10
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Technically this spill was related to our driver fueling the tractor trailer fuel tank and not the actual trailer vessel. However, Driver bypassed safety feature on the fuel dispenser handle by putting something under it to hold it open. Came into the terminal while fueling and when he returned fuel had spilled from his tank into the gravel and traveled downhill to the tree line. CDG managed the spill cleanup. Estimated gallons of diesel fuel was 30 gallons. Again, this is from fueling the tractor and not related to the trailer vessel.
